details.description: Join a competent person scheme to self-certify certain types of building work instead of getting building regulations approval from a council or inspector - how this works, how to join, current schemes

parts.title: Overview
parts.body:
You can join a competent person scheme to self-certify certain types of building work if you work in the building trade as an installer. This is instead of getting building regulations approval.

This means:

  • you don’t have to use a local council or approved building inspector to check your work
  • your customers benefit from lower prices as there are no building control fees

Membership is voluntary - you can still use local councils and building inspectors if you prefer.

Competent person scheme operators and installers must follow certain rules to make sure that their work complies with building regulations.

Download ‘Competent person schemes - conditions of authorisation’ (PDF, 60KB)

How to join a scheme

Contact one of the relevant schemes. They each have different application processes, rules and fees.

You’ll be assessed to make sure you meet the level of competence required before you’re approved. There will be ongoing inspections of your work to make sure standards are met if you become a member.

Current schemes and how schemes are authorised

You can find a list of current competent person schemes, and contact the relevant scheme for details about joining.

You can also find out more about how schemes are authorised.
